displayName.text: Pak Punjab Deli & Grocery Smoke Shop

Pak Punjab Deli & Grocery Smoke Shop

adrFormatAddress: 50 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: Really bad place to go. Overcharged me for everything. Said 27 dollars but charged 35 when I checked my bank account. The people there were rude as they were forcing me to get their chicken biryani. I am vegetarian. 7$ parantha that is not even seasoned correctly. Guys just save ur money it's not worth it.

text.text: Really bad place to go. Overcharged me for everything. Said 27 dollars but charged 35 when I checked my bank account. The people there were rude as they were forcing me to get their chicken biryani. I am vegetarian. 7$ parantha that is not even seasoned correctly. Guys just save ur money it's not worth it.

originalText.text: Pak Punjab Deli is a small deli that has a variety of packaged snacks and drinks as well as south Asian eats. it’s a small space packed with items along the perimeter. the hot foods available are on display in a deli case and heated up via microwave—different curries, rices, samosas, kebabs and more. Customer flow is drivers and Uber drivers who stop on break etc as well as random residents. there is no menu with prices on display which feels a bit weird since prices seem to change depending on who’s behind the counter. odd. prices have climbed here while quality seems to have stayed the same or fallen. recently, stopped here for kebabs to go and they were just okay at best. the curries seem kinda overpriced based on size and quality. but if you need some late night eats, this place will suffice

originalText.text:
A guy who works Wednesday night is the biggest scammer. When he working he flips the sign that writes all the price. Most of the time he charges extra money. Also, I realize whatever he charges extra money the money he put on the side.
I will recommend anything purchased please scan the computer and take a receipt.
whoever owner this place please keep eye On this employee he stolen your money. Most of the time he don’t put money cash counter he keep the money on the side.

originalText.text: Veggie samosa was soggy and lukewarm, similarly the lamb over rice was not heated well and quite cold. The plate was almost completely rice, and they charged me $14 for the lamb over rice and $2.5 for the samosa which is way higher than what I was expecting for quick deli food. Food wasn’t tasty, didn’t finish it.

originalText.text: Came here by accident. Hah. A friend told me to check out a place called Punjabi on 1st Ave. We didn't realize it was the wrong place toll after we ordered. It was tad pricey for what it was. Customer service was super nice and friendly. If you pay with cash you get a discount!
